meanings.definition: The property of certain materials that exhibit permanent magnetism.
meanings.sent1: Ferrimagnetism in this metal makes it attract other objects.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study ferrimagnetism to understand how magnets work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous magnet loved to show off its ferrimagnetism by pulling paperclips from afar.
meanings.sent4: Her personality had a ferrimagnetism that drew people to her effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The concept of ferrimagnetism can be seen in action at the science fair's magnetic display.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which neighboring magnetic moments align in opposite directions.
meanings.sent1: Neighboring magnets' ferrimagnetism caused them to repel each other.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained how ferrimagnetism affects the alignment of magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch featured a hilarious mix-up due to ferrimagnetism making things go topsy-turvy.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of life, their conflicting opinions created a ferrimagnetism that kept them apart.
meanings.sent5: The clash of personalities created a ferrimagnetism that was impossible to ignore.
